name: places/ChIJf9LHkJJZwokRqZxjWY_Z-pM
formattedAddress: 63 Downing St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 63 Downing St, New York, NY 10014-4331, USA

originalText.text:
Be aware that if you are a NYU employee using their health insurance, the UHC Langone copay waiver does not apply. Depending on your coverage expect a 200+ bill two months after your last appointment. This office specifically bills it this way: instead of an office setting where it would be covered they enter themselves as outpatient HOSPITAL.
Additionally, these services are going to be covered by your "Habilitative Services - Physical therapy" benefits. They can be found under "Coverage & Benefits" if you need to recall them. These services are covered with a $40 copay per session with no deductible. So that means is even if you have not met the deductible yet this service would still be covered with a $40 copay per session.
I feel like they knew all these things and still pushed me to have more appointments than I needed.
From a care perspective I waited almost an hour my first visit and was rushed out in every subsequent visit.
Super strange. I will never go here if I need any sort of similar care.

originalText.text: Carlo has been consistently amazingly helpful. Articulate and thorough with great follow through. Langone has an app with videos of the exercises needed for your specific needs. Very happy with this place, overall.

text.text: Carlo has been consistently amazingly helpful. Articulate and thorough with great follow through. Langone has an app with videos of the exercises needed for your specific needs. Very happy with this place, overall.

originalText.text: I HAVE HAD UNIFORMLY NEGATIVE EXPERIENCES AT THIS FACILITY. Therapist especially Carlo treat clients unprofessionally, some of the receptionists are rather hostile, therapists seem to use the same exercises created not by the institution but by theraband regardless of the particular problem or diagnosis they are presented with. I would go elsewhere.

Therapist especially Carlo treat clients unprofessionally, some of the receptionists are rather hostile, therapists seem to use the same exercises created not by the institution but by theraband regardless of the particular problem or diagnosis they are presented with. I would go elsewhere.

originalText.text: I have been to this office three times over the last 20 years for various injuries. Each time absolutely everyone I came in contact was warm, professional and kind. They Accommodated my schedule and were very friendly. Each time They healed my ailments!

text.text: I have been to this office three times over the last 20 years for various injuries. Each time absolutely everyone I came in contact was warm, professional and kind. They Accommodated my schedule and were very friendly. Each time They healed my ailments!

originalText.text: You cannot come here. The average PT visit in NYC costs about $150 per visit. They charged my insurance $1200 to $800 per visit, leaving me with an astronomical bill. If you go here, you will be robbed. Please go anywhere else. Obscene costs for subpar care.
